page.title: 12Henham dragon
page.content: In the 17th century a man riding a horse in Henham saw a "dragon".On arriving home he described the dragon as a 2-3metre long beast with sheep like eyes,very sharp teeth and small wings.Women,children and some men were scared to go out of the village because of the dragon although no damage was done nor was anyone hurt by it.Villagers had spread wild rumours about the dragon although some people thought it was only a diver bird blown off course.Not many people actually saw the dragon and those who did had usually just left one of the local public houses! These witnesses may not have been seeing too clearly! The dragon remains Henham's most famous legend and where it was first seen can still be visited at Birch Wood near Lodge Farm.
